channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Looking to have fun without alcohol? This guy has ideas that may help
item.description: If you're looking for inspiration to stick with Dry January, or you're worried about the cancer risk linked to alcohol, you may want to check out booze-free gatherings happening all over the country.
item.content:encoded: If you're looking for inspiration to stick with Dry January, or you're worried about the cancer risk linked to alcohol, you may want to check out booze-free gatherings happening all over the country.
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Fluoride analysis triggers renewed debate over what levels are safe for kids
item.description: A new study suggests a link between high levels of fluoride and lowered IQ. It's heating up arguments over fluoridating drinking water, which dentists say is critical for protecting teeth.
item.content:encoded:
A new study suggests a link between high levels of fluoride and lowered IQ. It's heating up arguments over fluoridating drinking water, which dentists say is critical for protecting teeth.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: More fires erupt in Southern California and spread to the Hollywood Hills
item.description: Three new fires broke out in Los Angeles and Ventura counties on Wednesday. California Gov. Gavin Newsom said more than 7,500 personnel are helping in the response to the infernos.
item.content:encoded:
Three new fires broke out in Los Angeles and Ventura counties on Wednesday. California Gov. Gavin Newsom said more than 7,500 personnel are helping in the response to the infernos.

(Image credit: Ethan Swope)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Imprisoned Belarus activist resurfaces after being incommunicado for over 700 days
item.description: He was last heard from in February 2023. Since then, authorities haven't released any information about his condition and barred his lawyer from visits.
item.content:encoded:
He was last heard from in February 2023. Since then, authorities haven't released any information about his condition and barred his lawyer from visits.

(Image credit: Ramil Nasibulin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: All 5 living presidents expected to attend Jimmy Carter's National Cathedral funeral
item.description: President Biden is expected to deliver a eulogy to former President Jimmy Carter at the National Cathedral service.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden is expected to deliver a eulogy to former President Jimmy Carter at the National Cathedral service.

(Image credit: Maansi Srivastava for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: What's next for Canada? 5 questions will help decide the future after Trudeau
item.description: "We're in a unique situation in Canadian politics," Shachi Kurl, president of the Angus Reid Institute, tells NPR. Voters need to replace a lame-duck leader — and cope with threats from Trump.
item.content:encoded:
"We're in a unique situation in Canadian politics," Shachi Kurl, president of the Angus Reid Institute, tells NPR. Voters need to replace a lame-duck leader — and cope with threats from Trump.

(Image credit: DAVE CHAN/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Special ed students benefit from being integrated at school. It doesn't always happen
item.description: Research shows including students with and without disabilities in the same classroom can benefit everyone. Two students with Down syndrome show what can be gained when that happens.
item.content:encoded:
Research shows including students with and without disabilities in the same classroom can benefit everyone. Two students with Down syndrome show what can be gained when that happens.

(Image credit: Katrina Ward for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: A major winter storm will bring snow to the South. Here are tips from winter experts
item.description: Southern states don't often deal with winter conditions, but New England does. New Hampshire especially has tips for how to prepare for a winter storm.
item.content:encoded:
Southern states don't often deal with winter conditions, but New England does. New Hampshire especially has tips for how to prepare for a winter storm.

(Image credit: Robb Hill for The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Mara Hoplamazian

item.title: Here's what's behind Russia cutting off its last gas line to Europe
item.description: A decades-long Russian-Ukrainian transit gas deal to Europe ended on Jan. 1. For now, the most acute effects are being felt in a region called Transnistria, on the eastern edge of Moldova.
item.content:encoded:
A decades-long Russian-Ukrainian transit gas deal to Europe ended on Jan. 1. For now, the most acute effects are being felt in a region called Transnistria, on the eastern edge of Moldova.

(Image credit: Akos Stiller)
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: U.S. stock markets close to honor former President Jimmy Carter
item.description: The New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq will both observe Thursday's national day of mourning in a Wall Street tradition dating back to 1865.
item.content:encoded:
The New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq will both observe Thursday's national day of mourning in a Wall Street tradition dating back to 1865.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan
